perturbation.original_text:
AGREEMENT PERIOD
This Agreement will be for the maximum period of six (6) months beginning for the commencement
date, renewable in accordance with the terms hereof, unless earlier terminated pursuant to this
Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
AGREEMENT PERIOD
This Agreement will be for the maximum period of six (6) months beginning for the commencement
date. This agreement can be extended at the sole discretion of VAL, irrespective of the terms outlined herein. This agreement can be earlier terminated pursuant to this
Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a maximum period of six months, "renewable in accordance with the terms hereof". The modification introduces ambiguity by stating that the agreement can be extended at the "sole discretion of VAL", negating the original renewal clause and creating uncertainty about the agreement's actual duration. It contradicts the premise of a fixed term with defined renewal processes.

perturbation.original_text:
PAYMENT TERMS
All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment
to the following individual below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text:
PAYMENT TERMS
All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment to the following individual below will be made according to VAL's payment schedule, which may not coincide with the completion and handover on the Project to VAL. VAL holds the right to withhold payment based on internal performance reviews.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that payment will be made within 7 days upon completion and handover. The modified text introduces uncertainty by stating that payment will be made according to VAL's schedule, which may not be within 7 days and VAL has the right to withhold payment. The clause will create confusion around the payment terms.

perturbation.original_text:
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND OWNERSHIP
All Intellectual Property during the project is owned by VAL, and will be turned over to VAL at
the conclusion of the project by Developer and after the fulfillment of all commercial obligations
by the VAL.
All rights and title to Duesey Coffee Intellectual Property created pursuant to the Project shall
belong to VAL and shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND OWNERSHIP
All Intellectual Property during the project is initially owned by the Developer, but VAL retains an option to acquire full ownership upon completion of the project. The transfer of IP rights is contingent on satisfactory performance as determined solely by VAL. The rights and title to Duesey Coffee Intellectual Property created pursuant to the Project shall be jointly managed by VAL and the Developer, pending a formal agreement on revenue sharing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that all Intellectual Property is owned by VAL. The modified version states that IP is initially owned by the Developer and introduces conditions for VAL to acquire ownership. This creates contradiction around IP ownership.
